net.tridentsdk.api.event.block

Class BlockPistonEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.tridentsdk.api.event.Event
      • net.tridentsdk.api.event.block.BlockEvent
        • net.tridentsdk.api.event.block.BlockPistonEvent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cancellable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PistonExtendEvent, PistonRetractEvent

    public abstract class BlockPistonEvent
extends BlockEvent
implements Cancellable
    Called whenever a piston extends or retracts

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BlockPistonEvent(Block block, Orientation direction, boolean retract, Block influenced) 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Orientation getDirection()
      Returns the direction that the piston is facing, for example if the piston head face of a block is on the north end of a block, then the Direction that this event returns will be north, does not change depending on whether this piston is extending or retracting, so a block may actually be moving south if this is returns north
      Block getInfluencedBlock()
      Gets the block that is being moved by this piston, if any
      boolean isCancelled() 
      boolean isExtending()
      Returns true if this piston is extending, convenience for !isRetracting()
      boolean isRetracting()
      Returns true if this piston is retracting
      boolean isSticky() 
      void setCancelled(boolean cancelled) 

      • Methods inherited from class net.tridentsdk.api.event.block.BlockEvent

        getBlock

      • Methods inherited from class net.tridentsdk.api.event.Event

        isAsync

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        public BlockPistonEvent(Block block,

    • Method Detail

      • getDirection

        public Orientation getDirection()
        Returns the direction that the piston is facing, for example if the piston head face of a block is on the north end of a block, then the Direction that this event returns will be north, does not change depending on whether this piston is extending or retracting, so a block may actually be moving south if this is returns north
        Returns:
        Orientation

      • isRetracting

        public boolean isRetracting()
        Returns true if this piston is retracting
        Returns:
        Boolean

      • isExtending

        public boolean isExtending()
        Returns true if this piston is extending, convenience for !isRetracting()
        Returns:
        Boolean

      • getInfluencedBlock

        public Block getInfluencedBlock()
        Gets the block that is being moved by this piston, if any

        If this is a piston extend event, this will return the first block in the series of blocks being pushed.

        Returns:
        the block being moved, may be null if air, or retracting from a block without this piston being sticky

      • isSticky

        public boolean isSticky()

      • isCancelled

        public boolean isCancelled()
        Specified by:
        isCancelled in interface Cancellable
        Returns:
        return true if event is set to cancelled

      • setCancelled

        public void setCancelled(boolean cancelled)
        Specified by:
        setCancelled in interface Cancellable
        Parameters:
        cancelled - set the cancellation state of the event
